message_1: If there are 8 students and a teacher needs to form a committee of 3 students, how many different committees can the teacher form?
message_2:
To form a committee of 3 students from a group of 8 students, we can use the combination formula, which is:

C(n, k) = n! / (k!(n-k)!)

where n is the total number of students (8 in this case), k is the number of students in the committee (3 in this case), and ! denotes the factorial function (e.g., 5! = 5 × 4 × 3 × 2 × 1).

So, in this case, we have:

C(8, 3) = 8! / (3!(8-3)!)

C(8, 3) = 8! / (3!5!)

C(8, 3) = (8 × 7 × 6 × 5 × 4 × 3 × 2 × 1) / ((3 × 2 × 1)(5 × 4 × 3 × 2 × 1))

C(8, 3) = (8 × 7 × 6) / (3 × 2 × 1)

C(8, 3) = 336 / 6

C(8, 3) = 56

So, the teacher can form 56 different committees of 3 students from a group of 8 students.
